text: The Kingdom of Afghanistan (; Dari:پادشاهی افغانستان) was a constitutional monarchy in Central Asia established in 1926 as a successor state to the Emirate of Afghanistan. It was proclaimed by its first king, Amanullah Khan, seven years after he acceded to the throne. The monarchy ended in the 1973 Afghan coup d'état. ==References== Category:1926 establishments in Asia Category:1973 disestablishments Category:20th century in Afghanistan
title: Kingdom of Afghanistan
